title: With all the back and forth blood shed at the time, did being deported keep lucky Luciano from being assassinated? - Quora

response.answer_text: Lucky Luciano was almost beaten to death. A photo reflected a “ dropping eye “ after the beating. The F.B.I. brokered a deal with the Mob during WW II. The German Abwehr had spies operating in the USA during WW II. An American Troop Transport, berthed in New York Harbor was the target of a German Sabator. An explosive device was planted on the vessel that rendered it unoperative. Long Shore American workers knew the culprit. He never planted another explosive device again. The Saboteur died from an accident.

With all the back and forth blood shed at the time, did being deported keep Lucky Luciano from being assassinated? The blood shed was mostly over by 1933/34. The “commission” governance arrangement proposed by Luciano and accepted by the NYC five Mafia families was successful in constraining the violence between the families. Luciano was in a relatively safe position afterwards and until his deportation in 1943.
